metadata.Title: CVE-2023-34324 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[linux/xen: Possible deadlock in Linux kernel event handling] Marek Marczykowski-Górecki discovered that the Xen event channel infrastructure implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. An attacker in a guest VM could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (paravirtualized device unavailability).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-34324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1025-oem - 6.1.0-1025.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1025-oem - 6.1.0-1025.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.

linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
